revised_title: Prostaglandin E1 and its Impact on Spleen Perfusion and Transmitter Uptake
tldr: The study investigates the effects of prostaglandin E1 on spleen perfusion and transmitter uptake in cats. The use of prostaglandin E1 prevents platelet aggregation, improving the perfusion and increasing transmitter overflow from the spleen. This discovery helps maintain a full and uniform circulation throughout the spleen, enhancing the study of adrenergic transmission processes.
